intro: Astragalus achezaensis, commonly known as the Acheza milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. Its leaves are usually compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus achezaensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native habitat.
